text: I know this is a common conversation on here but, does anyone use a project management system that integrates well with other project management systems?
#conflictofinterest
I know lots of people that use them for media queries.
I dont personaly, but they are much more dynamic.
I realize that but we’ve seen some tools out there that will pull in other PM systems data so you can work with it on your end
that’s kind of the ideal for us. We have several PM tools we use for different clients, we just kinda want to consolidate on our end so we can have 1 place to view everything we’re working on.
I could see that use case.
pen and paper?
and probably postage stamps
we are on asana for the most part.  is working for us
You might have to get Zapier involved. On a side note, I’m curious as to what those different PM tools are…

We use multiple basecamp accounts, multiple asana accounts, wrike, bitbucket issues(not really a PM tool but would be nice to integrate).

Then of course we have to handle things that come in via call/email/ message.

We’re just sick of having things in so many places. We’re fine working in all of the different tools - it’s just it’d be nice to have everything aggregate to one place so it’s easier to project manage internally. for example it’s hard for us to know what any one of us is actively working on without directly asking
We use TeamWork; I'm supposed to start a project here soon working with the API, I'll keep you posted with what I find
yea, we’re at the point where we’d be fine with building our own little integrations to make something work for us, but the further along the tool is toward making that sort of system the better.
our project and account managers LOVE Monday. not really sure of it’s capabilites which you are looking for though
we also use teamwork, we used to be on Asana but it just didn't work well for us. Teamwork does have some integrations including Asana & Basecamp
<https://integrations.teamwork.com/products/projects/>
the main one I use is the slack integration...I get slacks when I'm assigned tasks, or comments are made and can complete tasks from slack as well
OOH and the best is the option to directly email files from a client to the project so I don't have to download them to my desktop to then upload into TW
going to look into both of these
haha my adblocker was blocking their logo. I was like… this is the weirdest website ever
yeah they just "rebranded" yesterday and their logo isn't very cohesive with the rest of the site anymore
I think TeamWork might be my favourite so far.  Not very good for time tracking though.
I was just reading through their integrations and it looks like they have some time tracking options
I use <http://timingapp.com|timingapp.com> for time tracking so could care less about that aspect of any PM tool
I highly recommend <http://timingapp.com|timingapp.com> if you are like me and loathe manually turning on timers, and manually having to log everything you do.
we use the harvest integration with asana.  works like a charm for me
<@U7SL518D6> looks like it is only for Mac...we use PC on the AWS cloud most days of the week :disappointed:

my company uses Harvest, I personally pay for timing just so I don’t have to worry about did I hit the dang timer, or did I log everything I did in the day? because I often have to switch back n forth between tasks like mad throughout the day
Time tracking works great for us... feels native, but could be an add on (still getting used to it myself lol)
did HubSpot’s GrowthBot stop sending comics? :disappointed:
looks like it’s just not sending them automatically anymore, still gives you one if you ask it for a comic
